page.title: 07SKELMANTHORPE SCREENS
page.content: Skelmanthorpe Screens is a small part of Emley Moor Colliery. The coal is sent from Emley Moor to Skelmanthorpe by conveyor belt and at Skelmanthorpe coal is washed, sorted out into grades and then bagged. I decided to interview Mr. D. and Mr A. Jones. They told me about their jobs and things that other people have to do, eg: working on the face, office work and actually working down the pit. At Emley Moor the men that work down the pit have to lie on their sides, and, using a pickaxe,they pick the coal out. Although Skelmanthorpe Screens is due to close in the near future, some men who work there are trying to buy the pit and Skelmanthorpe Screens from the N C B (National Coal Board) to run privately.
